captions.text:
I'm in Colorado's winter
wonderland with an Adventure

bike, Adventure gear and
an adventure map.
Welcome to "RideApart."
[MOTORCYCLE ENGINE]
Wow!

Look at all these
number plates.
[MOTORCYCLE ENGINE]

For the finale of season two on
"RideApart" we were looking
for an adventure.

So when our friends at Butler
Maps invited us to their home

state of Colorado, they'd
already pre-run many of the

adventurous roads in their home
state that were just made
for motorcycling.

And they had the KTM 990
Adventure bike waiting for us.

Wouldn't need a second
invitation.

And in no time, I was riding
through the backroads of
Colorado on two wheels.
The plan was simple really--

just get away from the city,
away from traffic, away from

life's daily hassles caused
by others and just ride.

Ride in solitude, ride into the
unknown and go places that
I'd never been before.

Making those squiggles on the
map a motorcycle adventure.

We should also note
the time of year.
It's winter--
cold.

We're between snowstorms and the
weather was supposed to be
coming in later that evening.
But this is Colorado.
I'm surrounded by beauty--

hundreds of miles of trail
roads to ride.

So we just headed for the
mountaintops enthusiastic at
what we may encounter.
[TREE FALLING]
[SAWING TREE]

This is now getting pretty
treacherous.

Underneath this fresh snow
is just black ice--
super slippy.
I can't touch the brakes.
I can hardly touch the gas.

And we've got a long
way to go.

Well, this is definitely
an adventure.
[GRUNTING]
Woo.
Winter wonderland.
Oh man.
It's slippy.
Wow!
Just look at this.
It's absolutely--
Oh!
Cut.

So we came to beautiful Colorado
to see our friends at
Butler Maps.

Not only did they provide us
with a fantastic Adventure

motorcycle, but they provided
us with their map.
They've done the hard work.

They've gone all
over the place.

Hundreds of thousands of miles
they've racked up over the

last few years, going to various
different states

finding the most fantastic
motorcycling roads for you,

making it easy, rating them,
showing you on-road and even
off-road routes and trails.

It made it really, really easy
so that you can just get on

your motorcycle, get going
and enjoy your
motorcycle to the full.

So the reason why I'm able to
ride in such extreme, harsh,
cold conditions comfortably--

I have to contribute that all
to my fantastic gear.

Adventure Gear comes
with layers.

Not only have you got a
brilliant top coat, but you
got many layers underneath--

waterproof layers,
thermal layers.

And I've even got
a heated vest.

So another essential part of a
motorcycling gear are gloves.

Once your hands start
getting cold on a
motorcycle, game over.

Your hands start to freeze
up, your fingers.

And these are essential
items on a motorcycle.

These are what control
everything--
clutch, brake, throttle.

So getting cold hands
is a big no-no.

I'm wearing here from
Alpinestars Gortex winter

gloves, keeping your hands
warm, as well as dry--
essential.

But if that's not enough, the
KTM also comes with a set of
sweet heated hand grips.

So here we have the KTM 990
Adventure R. It's quite a
motorcycle.

Out of all the large Adventure
bikes that I've ridden, this

is the real deal if you want
to go exploring because it

just seems to love getting off
the well-trodden path.
I've been really surprised.

I've taken the bike all over the
place-- through the mud,

through the snow, even a little
bit of ice, which is
definitely a bit sketchy.
But the bike's been fantastic.

It doesn't need to just be stuck
to the highway or the

small roads or the really,
really well-packed gravel like
most bikes do.

This bike is almost like a
large, off-road motorcycle.

But on the road too,
it's brilliant.
It handles fantastic.
The brakes are precise.

The engine's got loads of power,
two massive fuel tanks,
a great chassis.

There's very little I can say
that's negative about this
motorcycle.

It's a really, really great
bike, and what's best about it
is the limits of the motorcycle
far exceed most riders.

So you can really
go and explore.
[MOTORCYCLE ENGINE]
Wow!

Look at all these
number plates.

It's Colorado, Texas,
Missouri.

That's one way to decorate
your house.

Now that's what adventure
riding is all about--

a bit of a plan, head off
into the unknown and
just enjoy the outdoors.
I've been lucky.

I've had one fantastic
motorcycle in the KTM, great

Adventure gear and I've been
warm the entire time.

I encourage everyone
to do the same.

Get cleated up and head
off into the unknown.

You'll have an absolutely
fantastic time.
Cheers.
Oh, wow.

We're in Leadville, North
America's highest
incorporated town.

It's over 10,000 feet and we
got here last night in an
absolute blizzard.

We've still got some more miles
to go, back country.

Anyway, Colorado's
been fantastic.
A proper way to start the day.
Now, Colorado, wow.
That's all I can say.

I've ridden motorcycles all over
the world, and this has

been one of the most brilliant
and epic motorcycling
experiences I've ever had.

And I will be back to
Colorado for more.

Yes, we're filming
just in case.
[LAUGHTER]

Yeah, filming me making
an ass of myself.

Just [INAUDIBLE] crash and we
have to turn the bike around.

title: Off-Road in the Snow on a KTM 990 Adventure - /RideApart

comments.text:
I used to live in Leadville. Great riding all around that area. Winter 
riding there is nearly impossible with 250" average snow fall per year. 
Best mountain riding time in Colorado are the months of July through 
September and you should always expect cold and snow at anytime.
